attributes.action: Cancel plans to extend congestion zone to north and south circular areas
attributes.additional_details:
This new congestion area is absolutely detrimental to; disabled citizens of London who solely rely on their own personal vehicles, to couriers, to cab drivers & to the general public. 

Many hospitals, GP practices and medical centres are inside the new congestion zone constantly paying for congestion zone charges will result in financial despair in a global pandemic. The government have urged the public not to use public transport, however we cannot afford to pay congestion charges daily.
attributes.background: Cancel the plans to extend the congestion zone to north and south circular areas.

rejection.details:
It has been reported that the UK Government has suggested that London's congestion zone be extended, but doing so would be a matter for the London Assembly and the London Mayor.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
